Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?

I had a 2-minute episode of violent, jerky movements of my right arm, and I was sweating a lot during the episode. I also felt a chill down my spine before it happened. After the episode, I experienced weakness in my right arm and couldn't lift it above my head for 2 hours.
How old are you and are you currently taking any medications?
I am 8 years old and I am not currently taking any medications.
Do you have any family history of epilepsy or seizures?
No, there is no family history of serious illness like epilepsy or seizures.
Have you had previous episodes like this one, or was this the first time?
I had an episode of jerky movements when I had a high-grade fever as a toddler.
Final Diagnosis: Focal epilepsy with secondary generalization.
